Government Mayor & City Council

At Large - Mayor Pro Tem - Chris Harris

Print Feedback
Share & Bookmark Share & Bookmark, Press Enter to show all options, press Tab go to next option
  • Email
  • Facebook
  • LinkedIn
  • Twitter
  • Reddit
Font Size: + -
Elected May 2018; Re-Elected November 2020; Re-Elected May 2023

Chris Harris was elected to the Katy City Council in 2018, 2020 and 2023, serving as Mayor Pro Tem since September 2019.

Councilmember Harris serves on the boards of Katy Area Chamber of Commerce, the Coastal Prairie Conservancy and Trustee at Katy First United Methodist Church.  Harris, a fifth-generation Texan, attended Sam Houston State University.

Chris and his wife, Danielle, a Katy native and public school educator, are a state licensed foster care family with the Methodist Children's Home and have five children.  Harris is, also, employed as a commissioned Texas Notary Public.

All have actively participated in their church and community, including: Lifetime Member Katy Heritage Society, Katy Development Authority, Charter Review Commission, Landscape Appeals Board, HOA Board President, volunteer firefighter, FAA licensed pilot, Katy Elementary Campus Advisory Team, Leadership Katy ISD, Katy ISD substitute teacher, Katy FFA Supporters 100 Club and Katy Prairie Conservancy Leadership Circle.

To contact Councilmember Harris directly, please e-mail councilmembers@cityofkaty.com.

City Maps Contact Us Latest News Public Documents

901 Avenue C, Katy, Texas 77493 | (281) 391-4800 | info@cityofkaty.com
